questions.question: A student measures the thickness of a book cover five times using a micrometer and records: 3.28 mm, 3.26 mm, 3.29 mm, 3.27 mm, and 3.28 mm. The manufacturer specifies the true thickness as 3.15 mm. How would you characterize these measurements?
questions.explanation: The average of the measurements is $(3.28 + 3.26 + 3.29 + 3.27 + 3.28)/5 = 16.38/5 = 3.276$ mm. The true value is 3.15 mm, so the measurements are off by 0.126 mm, making them not accurate. However, the measurements are all within a range of 0.03 mm (3.29 - 3.26 = 0.03 mm), showing good reproducibility and therefore good precision. Thus, the measurements are precise but not accurate.

questions.question: Calculate and express with correct significant figures: $(24.68 \times 3.1) - 12.4$
questions.explanation: First, perform the multiplication: $24.68 \times 3.1 = 76.508$. However, 3.1 has two significant figures, so the product should have two significant figures. Keeping full precision for the next step, we then subtract: $76.508 - 12.4 = 64.108$. When subtracting, we look at decimal places: 76.508 has three decimal places, 12.4 has one decimal place, so the result should have one decimal place: 64.1. But the multiplication limited us to two significant figures, so 64.1 rounds to 64 with two significant figures.

questions.question: Convert a speed of $110 \text{ km/h}$ to $\text{m/s}$.
questions.explanation: $110 \text{ km/h} \times \frac{1000 \text{ m}}{1 \text{ km}} \times \frac{1 \text{ h}}{3600 \text{ s}} = 110 \times 1000 \div 3600 = 110,000 \div 3600 = 30.555... \text{ m/s}$. Rounding to three significant figures gives 30.6 m/s.

questions.question: How many seconds are there in the month of October (31 days)? Express in scientific notation.
questions.explanation: $31 \text{ days} \times 24 \text{ h/day} \times 3600 \text{ s/h} = 31 \times 86,400 = 2,678,400 \text{ s}$. In scientific notation with four significant figures: $2.678 \times 10^6 \text{ s}$.

questions.question: Vector $\vec{A}$ has magnitude 15 units at $120^\circ$ from the $+x$ axis. Vector $\vec{B}$ has magnitude 10 units along the $-y$ axis. Find the magnitude and direction of $\vec{A} + \vec{B}$.
questions.explanation: $\vec{A}$ components: $A_x = 15 \cos 120^\circ = 15 \times (-0.5) = -7.5$, $A_y = 15 \sin 120^\circ = 15 \times 0.8660 = 12.99$. $\vec{B}$ components: $B_x = 0$, $B_y = -10$. Sum: $R_x = -7.5$, $R_y = 12.99 - 10 = 2.99$. Magnitude: $R = \sqrt{(-7.5)^2 + (2.99)^2} = \sqrt{56.25 + 8.94} = \sqrt{65.19} = 8.07$ units. Direction: $\theta = \tan^{-1}(2.99/7.5) = \tan^{-1}(0.3987) = 21.7^\circ$ above negative x-axis, so from +x axis: $180^\circ - 21.7^\circ = 158.3^\circ$.

questions.question: A subway train accelerates from rest at $1.8 \text{ m/s}^2$ for 10 seconds, then maintains constant speed for 25 seconds, then decelerates at $2.4 \text{ m/s}^2$ until stop. Find total distance.
A rock is thrown vertically upward from a cliff with initial velocity $15 \text{ m/s}$. It hits the ocean below after 5.2 seconds. How high is the cliff? ($g = 9.8 \text{ m/s}^2$)
questions.explanation: Let upward positive, cliff top at $y = 0$, ocean at $y = -h$. Then $-h = v_0t - \frac{1}{2}gt^2 = 15 \times 5.2 - 4.9 \times (5.2)^2 = 78 - 4.9 \times 27.04 = 78 - 132.496 = -54.496$. Therefore $h = 54.5 \text{ m}$.

questions.question: The velocity-time graph of an object is a straight line through $(1 \text{ s}, 8 \text{ m/s})$ and $(5 \text{ s}, 24 \text{ m/s})$. Find displacement during first 4 seconds.
questions.explanation: Slope $a = \frac{24-8}{5-1} = \frac{16}{4} = 4 \text{ m/s}^2$. Using point-slope: $v - 8 = 4(t - 1) \rightarrow v = 4t + 4$. Displacement $= \int_0^4 (4t + 4) dt = [2t^2 + 4t]_0^4 = 2(16) + 4(4) = 32 + 16 = 48 \text{ m}$.

questions.question: Two cars start from rest. Car A accelerates at $2.2 \text{ m/s}^2$ for 7 s, then constant speed. Car B accelerates at $2.8 \text{ m/s}^2$ for 6 s, then constant speed. Who is ahead after 14 s and by how much?
A ball is thrown vertically upward from ground with initial speed $28 \text{ m/s}$. Find maximum height and time in air. ($g = 9.8 \text{ m/s}^2$)
questions.explanation: At top, $v = 0$: $0 = 28^2 - 2(9.8)h \rightarrow h = \frac{784}{19.6} = 40.0 \text{ m}$. Time to top: $t = v_0/g = 28/9.8 = 2.86 \text{ s}$. Total time $= 2 \times 2.86 = 5.72 \text{ s}$.

questions.question: A projectile launched at $42 \text{ m/s}$ at $32^\circ$ above horizontal. Find velocity (magnitude and direction) after $3.2 \text{ s}$. ($g = 9.8 \text{ m/s}^2$)
A football kicked at $22 \text{ m/s}$ at $38^\circ$ above horizontal. Find range on level ground. ($g = 9.8 \text{ m/s}^2$)
questions.explanation: $v_{0y} = 22 \sin 38^\circ = 22 \times 0.6157 = 13.55 \text{ m/s}$. Time of flight $t = \frac{2v_{0y}}{g} = \frac{2 \times 13.55}{9.8} = \frac{27.1}{9.8} = 2.765 \text{ s}$. $v_{0x} = 22 \cos 38^\circ = 22 \times 0.7880 = 17.34 \text{ m/s}$. Range $R = v_{0x} \times t = 17.34 \times 2.765 = 47.95 \text{ m} \approx 48.0 \text{ m}$.

questions.question: A projectile reaches maximum height $75 \text{ m}$ and range $180 \text{ m}$. Find launch angle and initial speed. ($g = 9.8 \text{ m/s}^2$)
questions.explanation: $H = \frac{v_0^2 \sin^2 \theta}{2g} = 75 \rightarrow v_0^2 \sin^2 \theta = 2 \times 9.8 \times 75 = 1470$. $R = \frac{v_0^2 \sin 2\theta}{g} = 180 \rightarrow v_0^2 (2 \sin \theta \cos \theta) = 180 \times 9.8 = 1764 \rightarrow v_0^2 \sin \theta \cos \theta = 882$. Divide: $\frac{v_0^2 \sin^2 \theta}{v_0^2 \sin \theta \cos \theta} = \frac{1470}{882} \rightarrow \tan \theta = 1.6667$, $\theta = \tan^{-1}(1.6667) = 59.0^\circ$. $v_0^2 = \frac{1470}{\sin^2 59^\circ} = \frac{1470}{0.7348} = 2000.5 \rightarrow v_0 = 44.7 \text{ m/s}$.

questions.question: A boat can travel at $2.2 \text{ m/s}$ in still water. It heads directly across a $150 \text{ m}$ wide river flowing at $1.1 \text{ m/s}$. Find time to cross, downstream distance, and actual speed.
questions.explanation: Time to cross $t = \frac{150}{2.2} = 68.18 \text{ s}$. Downstream distance $= 1.1 \times 68.18 = 75.0 \text{ m}$. Actual speed $v = \sqrt{2.2^2 + 1.1^2} = \sqrt{4.84 + 1.21} = \sqrt{6.05} = 2.46 \text{ m/s}$.

questions.question: A plane flying horizontally at $180 \text{ m/s}$ at altitude $1200 \text{ m}$ releases a bomb. Find horizontal distance to impact. ($g = 9.8 \text{ m/s}^2$)
questions.explanation: Time to fall: $y = \frac{1}{2}gt^2 \rightarrow 1200 = 0.5 \times 9.8 \times t^2 \rightarrow t^2 = \frac{1200}{4.9} = 244.9 \rightarrow t = 15.65 \text{ s}$. Horizontal distance $= v \times t = 180 \times 15.65 = 2817 \text{ m} \approx 2820 \text{ m}$.

questions.question: A $25 \text{ kg}$ crate pulled across rough floor by horizontal rope with tension $90 \text{ N}$. Coefficient of kinetic friction $0.12$. Find acceleration. ($g = 9.8 \text{ m/s}^2$)
questions.explanation: Weight $= 25 \times 9.8 = 245 \text{ N}$, Normal force $= 245 \text{ N}$. Friction $f = 0.12 \times 245 = 29.4 \text{ N}$. Net force $F_{net} = 90 - 29.4 = 60.6 \text{ N}$. $a = \frac{60.6}{25} = 2.424 \text{ m/s}^2 \approx 2.42 \text{ m/s}^2$.

questions.question: Masses $m_1 = 8 \text{ kg}$ (on frictionless table) and $m_2 = 12 \text{ kg}$ (hanging) connected by light string over frictionless pulley. Find acceleration and tension. ($g = 9.8 \text{ m/s}^2$)
questions.explanation: For $m_2$: $m_2g - T = m_2a$. For $m_1$: $T = m_1a$. Substitute: $m_2g - m_1a = m_2a \rightarrow m_2g = a(m_1 + m_2)$. $a = \frac{m_2g}{m_1 + m_2} = \frac{12 \times 9.8}{20} = \frac{117.6}{20} = 5.88 \text{ m/s}^2$. $T = m_1a = 8 \times 5.88 = 47.04 \text{ N} \approx 47.0 \text{ N}$.

questions.question: A $20 \text{ kg}$ box pushed up $22^\circ$ incline with $150 \text{ N}$ force parallel to incline. Coefficient of kinetic friction $0.18$. Find acceleration. ($g = 9.8 \text{ m/s}^2$)
questions.explanation: Weight component down incline $= mg \sin \theta = 20 \times 9.8 \times \sin 22^\circ = 196 \times 0.3746 = 73.42 \text{ N}$. Normal force $N = mg \cos \theta = 20 \times 9.8 \times \cos 22^\circ = 196 \times 0.9272 = 181.7 \text{ N}$. Friction $f = 0.18 \times 181.7 = 32.71 \text{ N}$ (down incline). Net force up $= 150 - 73.42 - 32.71 = 43.87 \text{ N}$. $a = \frac{43.87}{20} = 2.194 \text{ m/s}^2 \approx 2.19 \text{ m/s}^2$.

questions.question: A $2.5 \text{ kg}$ block sits on $7.5 \text{ kg}$ block on frictionless table. Coefficient of static friction $0.45$. Max horizontal force on bottom block so top doesn't slip? ($g = 9.8 \text{ m/s}^2$)
questions.explanation: Max friction on top $f_{max} = \mu_s m_{top} g = 0.45 \times 2.5 \times 9.8 = 0.45 \times 24.5 = 11.025 \text{ N}$. Max acceleration of top $a_{max} = \frac{f_{max}}{m_{top}} = \frac{11.025}{2.5} = 4.41 \text{ m/s}^2$. Total mass $= 2.5 + 7.5 = 10 \text{ kg}$. $F_{max} = m_{total} \times a_{max} = 10 \times 4.41 = 44.1 \text{ N}$.

questions.question: An $85 \text{ kg}$ person on scale in elevator. Scale reads $925 \text{ N}$. Find acceleration (magnitude and direction). ($g = 9.8 \text{ m/s}^2$)
questions.explanation: Weight $= mg = 85 \times 9.8 = 833 \text{ N}$. Scale reads $N = 925 \text{ N} > 833 \text{ N}$, so accelerating upward. $N - mg = ma \rightarrow 925 - 833 = 85a \rightarrow 92 = 85a \rightarrow a = 1.082 \text{ m/s}^2$ upward.

questions.question: A $1.2 \text{ kg}$ object on a $1.5 \text{ m}$ string swings in a horizontal circle. String makes $55^\circ$ with vertical. Find tension and speed.
questions.explanation: Vertical: $T \cos 55^\circ = mg = 1.2 \times 9.8 = 11.76 \text{ N}$, $T = \frac{11.76}{\cos 55^\circ} = \frac{11.76}{0.5736} = 20.5 \text{ N}$. Radius $r = L \sin 55^\circ = 1.5 \times 0.8192 = 1.229 \text{ m}$. Horizontal: $T \sin 55^\circ = \frac{mv^2}{r} \rightarrow 20.5 \times 0.8192 = \frac{1.2 v^2}{1.229} \rightarrow 16.79 = \frac{1.2 v^2}{1.229} \rightarrow 16.79 \times 1.229 = 1.2 v^2 \rightarrow 20.63 = 1.2 v^2 \rightarrow v^2 = 17.19 \rightarrow v = 4.15 \text{ m/s}$.

questions.question: A $1400 \text{ kg}$ car rounds curve of radius $65 \text{ m}$ on flat road at $20 \text{ m/s}$. Find minimum coefficient of static friction to prevent skidding.
questions.explanation: Friction provides centripetal force: $\mu_s mg = \frac{mv^2}{r} \rightarrow \mu_s = \frac{v^2}{rg} = \frac{20^2}{65 \times 9.8} = \frac{400}{637} = 0.628 \approx 0.63$.

questions.question: Find gravity at $800 \text{ km}$ above Earth's surface. ($M_E = 5.97 \times 10^{24} \text{ kg}$, $R_E = 6.37 \times 10^6 \text{ m}$, $G = 6.67 \times 10^{-11}$)
Satellite at $600 \text{ km}$ altitude. Find orbital speed and period. (Use values above)
questions.explanation: $r = 6.37 \times 10^6 + 6.0 \times 10^5 = 6.97 \times 10^6 \text{ m}$. $v = \sqrt{\frac{GM}{r}} = \sqrt{\frac{3.98 \times 10^{14}}{6.97 \times 10^6}} = \sqrt{5.71 \times 10^7} = 7558 \text{ m/s} \approx 7560 \text{ m/s}$. $T = \frac{2\pi r}{v} = \frac{2\pi \times 6.97 \times 10^6}{7558} = \frac{4.38 \times 10^7}{7558} = 5795 \text{ s}$. $5795/60 = 96.6 \text{ min}$.

questions.question: Roller coaster loop radius $18 \text{ m}$. Minimum speed at top?
questions.explanation: $mg = \frac{mv^2}{r} \rightarrow v = \sqrt{gr} = \sqrt{9.8 \times 18} = \sqrt{176.4} = 13.28 \text{ m/s} \approx 13.3 \text{ m/s}$.

questions.question: A $6 \text{ kg}$ box pulled $8 \text{ m}$ by $55 \text{ N}$ force at $35^\circ$ above horizontal. $\mu_k = 0.25$. Find net work. ($g = 9.8 \text{ m/s}^2$)
questions.explanation: $W_F = Fd \cos \theta = 55 \times 8 \times \cos 35^\circ = 440 \times 0.8192 = 360.4 \text{ J}$. $F_y = 55 \sin 35^\circ = 55 \times 0.5736 = 31.55 \text{ N}$. $N = mg - F_y = 6 \times 9.8 - 31.55 = 58.8 - 31.55 = 27.25 \text{ N}$. $f = \mu_k N = 0.25 \times 27.25 = 6.81 \text{ N}$. $W_f = -f \times d = -6.81 \times 8 = -54.48 \text{ J}$. Net work $= 360.4 - 54.48 = 305.9 \text{ J} \approx 306 \text{ J}$.

questions.question: A $7 \text{ kg}$ block slides down frictionless incline from height $8 \text{ m}$. Find speed at bottom.
questions.explanation: $mgh = \frac{1}{2}mv^2 \rightarrow v = \sqrt{2gh} = \sqrt{2 \times 9.8 \times 8} = \sqrt{156.8} = 12.52 \text{ m/s} \approx 12.5 \text{ m/s}$.

questions.question: Spring $k = 800 \text{ N/m}$ compressed $0.25 \text{ m}$ launches $1.2 \text{ kg}$ block on rough surface. $\mu_k = 0.2$. How far does it slide? ($g = 9.8 \text{ m/s}^2$)
questions.explanation: Spring energy $E = \frac{1}{2}kx^2 = 0.5 \times 800 \times 0.0625 = 400 \times 0.0625 = 25 \text{ J}$. Friction force $f = \mu_k mg = 0.2 \times 1.2 \times 9.8 = 0.2 \times 11.76 = 2.352 \text{ N}$. $E = f \times d \rightarrow 25 = 2.352d \rightarrow d = \frac{25}{2.352} = 10.63 \text{ m} \approx 10.6 \text{ m}$.

questions.question: A $65 \text{ kg}$ runner increases speed from $2.5 \text{ m/s}$ to $6.5 \text{ m/s}$ in $3.5 \text{ s}$. Find average power.
A pump lifts $450 \text{ kg}$ of water per minute from a $25 \text{ m}$ deep well. Output power? ($g = 9.8 \text{ m/s}^2$)
questions.explanation: Work per minute $= mgh = 450 \times 9.8 \times 25 = 450 \times 245 = 110,250 \text{ J}$. Power $= \frac{110,250}{60} = 1837.5 \text{ W} \approx 1840 \text{ W}$.

questions.question: A $0.3 \text{ kg}$ ball at $22 \text{ m/s}$ hits wall and rebounds at $18 \text{ m/s}$. Contact time $0.06 \text{ s}$. Find impulse and average force.
questions.explanation: $p_i = 0.3 \times 22 = 6.6 \text{ kg·m/s}$ (toward wall), $p_f = 0.3 \times (-18) = -5.4 \text{ kg·m/s}$. Impulse $J = p_f - p_i = -5.4 - 6.6 = -12.0 \text{ N·s}$ (magnitude $12.0 \text{ N·s}$). $F_{avg} = \frac{|J|}{\Delta t} = \frac{12.0}{0.06} = 200 \text{ N}$ away from wall.

questions.question: A $0.015 \text{ kg}$ bullet at $600 \text{ m/s}$ embeds in $2.5 \text{ kg}$ block at rest on frictionless surface. Find final velocity and energy lost.
questions.explanation: $0.015 \times 600 = (2.515)v_f \rightarrow 9 = 2.515v_f \rightarrow v_f = 3.58 \text{ m/s}$. Initial KE $= 0.5 \times 0.015 \times 600^2 = 0.0075 \times 360,000 = 2700 \text{ J}$. Final KE $= 0.5 \times 2.515 \times (3.58)^2 = 1.2575 \times 12.82 = 16.12 \text{ J}$. Energy lost $= 2700 - 16.12 = 2683.88 \text{ J} \approx 2680 \text{ J}$.

questions.question: A $5 \text{ kg}$ ball moving at $8 \text{ m/s}$ collides elastically with stationary $3 \text{ kg}$ ball. Find final velocities.
questions.explanation: $v_{1f} = \frac{m_1 - m_2}{m_1 + m_2}v_{1i} = \frac{5-3}{8} \times 8 = \frac{2}{8} \times 8 = 2 \text{ m/s}$. $v_{2f} = \frac{2m_1}{m_1 + m_2}v_{1i} = \frac{2 \times 5}{8} \times 8 = \frac{10}{8} \times 8 = 10 \text{ m/s}$.

questions.question: A $6000 \text{ kg}$ truck at $15 \text{ m/s}$ hits stationary $2500 \text{ kg}$ car. After, truck moves at $9 \text{ m/s}$. Find car's velocity and collision type.
questions.explanation: $6000 \times 15 = 6000 \times 9 + 2500v_c \rightarrow 90,000 = 54,000 + 2500v_c \rightarrow 36,000 = 2500v_c \rightarrow v_c = 14.4 \text{ m/s}$. Initial KE $= 0.5 \times 6000 \times 225 = 3000 \times 225 = 675,000 \text{ J}$. Final KE $= 0.5 \times 6000 \times 81 + 0.5 \times 2500 \times (14.4)^2 = 243,000 + 1250 \times 207.36 = 243,000 + 259,200 = 502,200 \text{ J}$. Energy lost, so inelastic.

questions.question: A $0.25 \text{ kg}$ ball at $12 \text{ m/s}$ hits stationary $0.4 \text{ kg}$ ball. After, first moves at $6 \text{ m/s}$ at $50^\circ$ to original. Find second ball's velocity.
A wave has frequency $320 \text{ Hz}$ and wavelength $1.2 \text{ m}$. Find speed and period.
questions.explanation: $v = f\lambda = 320 \times 1.2 = 384 \text{ m/s}$. $T = \frac{1}{f} = \frac{1}{320} = 0.003125 \text{ s} = 3.125 \text{ ms} \approx 3.13 \text{ ms}$.

questions.question: Sound in air has $\lambda = 1.1 \text{ m}$ at $20^\circ \text{C}$ ($v = 343 \text{ m/s}$). Find $f$. In water ($v = 1480 \text{ m/s}$), find new $\lambda$.
questions.explanation: $f = \frac{343}{1.1} = 311.8 \text{ Hz} \approx 312 \text{ Hz}$. $\lambda_{water} = \frac{1480}{311.8} = 4.75 \text{ m}$.

questions.question: Two speakers in phase at $500 \text{ Hz}$. Destructive interference at point $2.8 \text{ m}$ and $3.3 \text{ m}$ from speakers. Find possible speed of sound.
Train whistle at $850 \text{ Hz}$ approaches at $20 \text{ m/s}$, then recedes. Frequencies heard? ($v_{sound} = 343 \text{ m/s}$)
questions.explanation: Approaching: $f' = 850 \times \frac{343}{343 - 20} = 850 \times \frac{343}{323} = 850 \times 1.0619 = 902.6 \text{ Hz} \approx 903 \text{ Hz}$. Receding: $f' = 850 \times \frac{343}{343 + 20} = 850 \times \frac{343}{363} = 850 \times 0.9449 = 803.2 \text{ Hz} \approx 803 \text{ Hz}$.

questions.question: String length $1.1 \text{ m}$, mass $5.5 \text{ g}$, tension $120 \text{ N}$. Find fundamental and 3rd harmonic frequencies.
Charges $+5 \mu \text{C}$ and $-8 \mu \text{C}$ are $0.25 \text{ m}$ apart. Find force magnitude and direction. ($k = 9 \times 10^9 \text{ N·m}^2/\text{C}^2$)
questions.explanation: $F = \frac{k|q_1q_2|}{r^2} = \frac{9 \times 10^9 \times |(5 \times 10^{-6})(-8 \times 10^{-6})|}{(0.25)^2} = \frac{9 \times 10^9 \times 4.0 \times 10^{-11}}{0.0625} = \frac{0.36}{0.0625} = 5.76 \text{ N}$. Opposite charges attract.

questions.question: Three $+4 \mu \text{C}$ charges at vertices of equilateral triangle side $0.2 \text{ m}$. Force on one charge?
questions.explanation: Force between two: $F = \frac{kq^2}{r^2} = \frac{9 \times 10^9 \times (4 \times 10^{-6})^2}{(0.2)^2} = \frac{9 \times 10^9 \times 1.6 \times 10^{-11}}{0.04} = \frac{0.144}{0.04} = 3.6 \text{ N}$. Two forces at $60^\circ$: resultant $= \sqrt{3.6^2 + 3.6^2 + 2 \times 3.6^2 \cos 60^\circ} = \sqrt{12.96 + 12.96 + 2 \times 12.96 \times 0.5} = \sqrt{12.96 + 12.96 + 12.96} = \sqrt{38.88} = 6.24 \text{ N}$.

questions.question: $R_1 = 25 \Omega$, $R_2 = 40 \Omega$ in parallel, then series with $R_3 = 30 \Omega$. Find equivalent resistance.
$24 \text{ V}$ battery with $R_1 = 15 \Omega$ and $R_2 = 25 \Omega$ in series. Find current, voltages, power in $R_2$.
A $200 \text{ W}$, $120 \text{ V}$ bulb. Find $R$ and $I$. At $125 \text{ V}$, find actual power.

Light of wavelength $380 \text{ nm}$ on metal with work function $2.8 \text{ eV}$. Find $KE_{max}$ in eV and J. ($h = 6.63 \times 10^{-34} \text{ J·s}$, $c = 3 \times 10^8 \text{ m/s}$, $1 \text{ eV} = 1.6 \times 10^{-19} \text{ J}$)
de Broglie wavelength of electron at $2.2 \times 10^6 \text{ m/s}$? ($m_e = 9.11 \times 10^{-31} \text{ kg}$, $h = 6.63 \times 10^{-34} \text{ J·s}$)
Spaceship at $0.92c$ relative to Earth. How long does a $3$-hour Earth event take on the ship?
Energy from converting $0.75 \text{ kg}$ mass to energy? ($c = 3 \times 10^8 \text{ m/s}$)
Sample half-life $10$ hours. Initial $200$ g. After $40$ hours, how much remains? Fraction decayed?
questions.explanation: $40$ hours $= 4$ half-lives ($40/10 = 4$). Remaining $= 200 \times (\frac{1}{2})^4 = 200 \times \frac{1}{16} = 12.5 \text{ g}$. Fraction decayed $= 1 - \frac{1}{16} = \frac{15}{16}$.
